description: From Middle English fervent, from Old French fervent, from Latin fervens, ferventem, present participle of fervere (“to boil, ferment, glow, rage”).

adjectives.description: fervent (comparative more fervent, superlative most fervent)

entries.meaning: Exhibiting particular enthusiasm, zeal, conviction, persistence, or belief.
examples: As I returned my fervent hopes were dashed by so many fears.

entries.meaning: Having or showing emotional warmth, fervor, or passion.
examples: Never again would those fresh lips touch his lips with their fervent kiss!
